_coqGn6TSlJBAJrkUFNO_g.text: What a cute lil place!! The famous Nathan hot dogs just make everything even better!! How in our many foot travels around Uptown the last month or two we never found this lil gem I'll never know. QCBC is "tucked up" in the French Quarter, once again a place found completely by accident while looking for a place to eat. Price is very reasonable for the quality, my husband had the Carolina dog, I a simple plain Nathan's dog with yummy beer cheese and grilled onions. We both enjoyed our dogs and will very likely go back. The chili was very good, and we will certainly have to go back for a bowl of chili. That said for hot dog chili my husband isn't a fan of chili w beans. That certainly won't stop us from going back!! Honestly what's better than an ice cold beer and a Nathan's hot dog on a late Saturday afternoon??? Our simple meal and drink took us both back to the early days of our marriage when we'd get a 25 cent draft, 15 cent hot dogs and play pool for another 25 cents!!! Too bad QCBC doesn't have pool tables! They do have a decent beer list you can choose from both local and non local breweries. I had a tangerine wheat and OMG was it one of the best beers I've ever had!! If you've not taken the time to check QCBC out yet you are missing good food, good ice cold beer and a cool lil place to enjoy them!! They have both indoor and out door seating.

nbQdwAEKjaGbAXDSr2GdMw.text: This is EXTRA legit.  So legit it motivated me to actually write a review on Yelp.  No weak sauce pickled jalapenos, they give you the fresh ones on top your chili.  Flavors are fresh and tasty.  Far from your average restaurant chili, i.e. it doesn't come frozen in a bucket.    Do yourself and the owner operators a favor and get some!!!!!

Qzgz1TlOkTN6ACdaKWJHxw.text: Two hotdogs and a drink for $4. YUMMY!!! It is in Greenwhich village and two doors down from Queen City Beer and Chili. The coffee at Queen City Beer and Chili is the best.

7Ki-OKDrxf00EdMuNuQX0A.text: Pretty freaking good! The vegan chili is worth it.

koCaB1Ojng_4baKVtV507g.text: Had some Fantastic chili and a great hot dog! Super friendly, super fast.  Definitely coming back.

bB-d0WIEbosLO3FPJpi3cw.text: I was blown away by this place. I took my wife there this past Monday just to check it out and WOW am I glad I did. I went for the nachos and already know what I'm getting next time I'm in town. Not only was the food amazing but the hospitality provided by AJ made my visit that much better. Do yourselves a favor and head there right now!!!!

1brUfx0PcqVq9LyA2phgig.text: Great chili dogs! Service was quick and easy! Hot dogs could have been a little bigger but the chili was good!

QWXpVm9wKrNYwVAQPEnK1Q.text: These are the best burgers in the city. I appreciate that they go with two small patties versus one big one for maximum char flavor!  Very good fries also. This is my (and several other co-workers) go to place for a burger in Uptown.  Only bummer is they don't serve iced tea. But I am over that.

LDvNBqh-RBabaEBIz4UT2A.text: The special chili is always on point..Haven't checked out the beer selection as I go for lunch (can't drink during work hours) but chili is great

ILEHfpTMVV925R5G9B-_eg.text: Real laid back atmosphere......GREAT food!  Chili and hot dogs the specialty.....Attentive service ......off the beaten path.....be sure not miss it!

CHjVOU3Mzu_Ndi5m5VCu8w.text: A miss overall. Gives you plastic bowls and silverware. Are they trying to make this a to-go place or a sit and eat? Pretty expensive too for chili. Chili was pretty good to be fair.

jon6Nk9dg2PMwulw2CCJ-Q.text: So disgusting that I'm surprised to see the other reviews. A place that specializes in chili but has gross tasting, barely warm chili. Sorry, theres WAY too many better food options just steps away.

ucKvXRyWccM6YksTzhM_VQ.text: As a recent transplant, I was very excited to find a Cincinnati style coney in Charlotte.  Grabbed one for take out.  Quick in and out, no waiting.  The taste of the Coney is very close to a skyline.  It is missing just a smidge of something, but truly not a bad coney.  I will be going back again for another coney and to try some of the craft beers on tap!

3wREkirCL5JyWc9eJgQ8aA.text: Nice to have a growler shop in Brevard Court. Came here for lunch and got it to go. I was impressed by the chili cheese nachos. Hand cut potato chips, fresh chili, fresh jalapeno slices, and the beer cheese was better than any processed nacho cheese. My bowels paid for it later, but it was worth it...My husband had a bacon cheeseburger, and he said he'll come here first next time he's craving a burger. He called it a "real" burger, not some frozen precut patty. The have fountain orange fanta. You never see that! 3 of us ate for under $30 and still had 20 minutes before lunch hour was over. This spot is definitely going into rotation.

iaKiq2OqT1tnRe7foeREiw.text: Good chili joint, excellent beer selection. Neat little joint for sure. You want chili and or chili dogs or chili burgers,,,,. Here you go.

4rJin6ZiWCWzFyLq3kAvKw.text: The burger was great! It was just the right size so you don't over-stuff yourself. The fried jalepeno's were amazing!! (Hint: put them on your burger for some extra texture and a bit of a kick, you will love it! trust me). The pretzels were really good as well with the beer cheese (which was really good). Would definitely try it!

ohDxyh1XJuJp8HZTPHMMTQ.text: Great food, excellent beer choices, I would recommend the peach cider! Service was excellent as well!

Whe8DfV1dRE9z-_B5qdz-A.text: Best chili cheese fries I've ever had! Good burgers as well, but be sure to get some beer cheese on the side to push them up even higher.

A85KxJdT0-GJu3KgH932yg.text: Super dank chili on top of creative dogs, burgers, and nachos. Long list of craft beers on tap. Perfect spot for a casual date. Underrated

1J0fHEg4XPbtkyuqJKU-oQ.text: In full Dora the Explorer mode I found this gem on Yelp and decided to walk over and glad I did! I was welcomed by the lovely bartender Brandy who recommended an awesome brew & the North Carolina Chilli Burger.   The crafted beer list is displayed and updated regularly,  I love the selection of small breweries from across the US.   Must try: North Carolina chilli,  Tangerine Wheat Ale & Pineapple Sculpin IPA  oh my absolute favorite is the Jalapeno Bites! Do yourself a favor add them to your burger and get a side of them!

1NOdz5OM1o7zICmVr9lF-A.text: This is how a burger should taste!  Super friendly staff, great beer selection and awesome food!  Quaint little dining area in Brevard Court Uptown with a couple of outdoor seating options for some fun people watching.  Definitely would recommend checking this spot out!

lOecDyqYp4TEJRdP3S0obg.text: Overpriced boiled Oscar Meyer Weiner hotdogs and cheap store bought buns. The one and only time I came here, it took about 40 minutes to get our food. We were four of the 6 people in the restaurant. Pretty sure the same person serving was also cooking.

_6gRx2PEXo9hUdsumsVyAA.text: The beer selection is awesome - 20 beers (and 2 wines) on tap!! And they're from all around the country - some local in Charlotte, some from all the way in California! You must try the "Good morning Vietnam" (coffee blonde ale) it's the BEST! The food is great if you're looking for some nice good bar food to go with the beer. Definitely returning, can't wait to make it my favorite local happy hour spot

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. Very cute place, love the woodwork and the growlers are so cool I bought one just to keep change in ;)
Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. Very cool, hip place! Love the wood and especially the 20 beers (and 2 wines) on tap!!

eueGWlSqU_WUa_sic2gO3g.text: Hard to find but worth it. More than 20 beers on tap. Burgers, hot dogs, and chili are the staples of this place. Small, but with a friendly staff. You cannot go wrong here.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States

-EIjUhXeBZ2CH9ieqJwo8Q.text: First time going to QCBC and it definitely won't be the last. Tried the burger of the day "The Fatty" and it was one of the best burgers I've had. The patties were rolled with onion and jalapeno topped with a Sriracha ranch sauce. Highly recommended! Great craft brew selection as well.

IajMJuAHqX8TLE7dw5YMLA.text: Holy SHIT.  A)Thank you for not having 300 things on your fucking menu. Be good at what you do and I will love you (and now I do)  B)Menu items are hilariously named (not in a kitschy way, but actually funny  C)Nice beer selection  D)Owners are cool and there's a really good look and feel to the place.  If I lived in Charlotte, this place would be the reason I die of a blood clot.

-dHcJl7GKm_YwXkIu942Aw.text: Omg i was visiting from Miami and wanted a burger so this place was perfect! I got their award winning burger and it was perfection, it felt homemade. Definitely coming here again!

INn6dyyHDLrAL0lkbRdNRA.text: Absolutely stunning cheeseburger. Beer cheese is also outstanding for dipping fries in. Don't miss this place. Run, don't walk here. I'll definitely be back to try the jalapeno mushroom caps and one of the daily specialty burgers. Great beer specials and happy hour spot as well.

a-IQB4kbvAq20Nf5BkDeFQ.text: I'm the guy who has complained for 15 years that you can't get a good chili dog in Charlotte. Just got back from lunch.I had a burger and a Carolina chili dog. Fantastic! By far the best in Charlotte - no kidding. Finally I can stop complaining. Of course it's not located in Blakeney so there is still that to rant about.

oakH73IR9bNbbPgEO9mCEQ.text: Horrid service Bartender and manager with horrible attitude. Any question he'll answer rudely. I was appalled. When i went to ask my friend wht he wanted to get he said I don't go there they have bad service. I thought maybe he's having a bad day, I guess everday he's like that.

kNWaU_SyldQANfa1oZYT3g.text: Found this awesome spot while visiting charlotte. Loved the pretzel with the beer cheese dip. Lots of excelente craft beers to try.  The hotdog choices are amazing!  The place is a bit small but cozy, the staff is cool. Would definitely recommend this place.

qTBneuTWCgIGpo4g5Q2gtw.text: Cool concept.  Nothing like it in Charlotte.  If you're already in the area, definitely worth getting over some of the other courtyard spots.  I wouldn't say it's mouthgasm quality, but it's definitely solid....

6woLBjWnebMk3ObSueVvBQ.text: Food could be great but we would never know! The fact that you have 1 persons behind the bar taking orders and bartending is ridicules! Get it together guys... It's the 4th hire staff get prepared. How about putting a sign on the locked door that says please you the "other door" won't be back won't ever recommend a place that can't serve customers properly.

ACmNYeVb-8SiK2LdH3BEjA.text: Place is legit. I don't play no games when it comes to coneys and neither do they. Slightly disappointed they don't have a Chicago style dog but I came for the coney and it was on point.   I don't drink a lot of beer so I'd like to see them add some old fashion style soda pop or maybe a root beer on tap. However My old lady got a beer and enjoyed it.   Great food, great service, great atmosphere and great prices.  I'll be back to Queen City beer & chili by the end of the month.

im4xBHF8DiD7d7Z7oSPLFw.text: Wow, I haven't written a review for this place. I'm so slacking. So when I was working in Uptown on pay days I would walk around and try to find something to eat. I came across this place. So the chili is freaking great. Love the burger and the fried jalapeno chips are just awesome. They have like 20 beers on tap.  The staff super friendly makes me miss working Uptown and my lunch break beer. :)

K2ZCWQnvc_PU40CPYcHXTg.text: Another good find through Yelp!  A colleague and I wanted something simple and quick for dinner. We both like chill  and beer is a must. Stopped in and did well in both departments. Great little place. Met the owner on a somewhat slow night and had a great chat. The chili and Reuben dog was the bomb!  If you are in Charlotte, make it a must try place. By the way, get the one pound bowl. Just the right size!

UQTi5IsqBmI5x5UPD6ss9w.text: This place is awesome. Ambiance is cozy and inviting. Craft beer is on point, and the food is great. You're only going to find Burgers, Dogs, Chili, and Fries here, but do you really need anything else? We went prior to a Panthers game and really enjoyed ourselves. We will be back for sure.

5-V66eSXpai5nVtOAJ4Qfg.text: I went there once for chili and have returned once a week since. I'm hooked! This is the best damn chili I've ever had. The spices and heat taste amazing.

nhBKpLVUW1gl8pe2FvxekA.text: I love hot dogs, so when I heard about this place I knew I had to try it. I stopped in Saturday night with a friend and wasn't sure what to expect! The location is small and inviting. They have several beers on tap that you can choose from by looking through the laptop. You can even buy a growler! The menu is pretty simple. We each got two hot dogs; the Carolina Style Chili Dog and the Cincinnati Coney. Both were great, we also split a side of fries which were fresh out of the fryer. They were cooked perfectly. It's a good spot to grab a quick bite to eat or have a beer. The staff was super friendly. We'll definitely be back!

d9jjW0T5RtFEUyMirEnsBA.text: Had no idea this spot was in the French Quarter, and it does not disappoint! Johanna was awesome, the beer selection is huge, and the food is great. I've been loyal to the French Quarter restaurant but QCBC has totally won me over!

RG-86nTl6_yKYJqp-2hSAg.text: Don't skip this place.  Great burgers!   Got the pimento fries (also killer). And the burgers came with the best fried pickles I've ever had.  Service was great.  The vibe is just right.  Chill have some food and a cold beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States

q57UMB6YSD55Rwz0Bddg5w.text: Don't let the photo fool you. This is a burger and beer joint that delivers the goods. The beer selection featured a nice amount of local craft brews and I was able to try a few I'd never had before. But the Star was the cheese coney. I went to school outside of Cincinnati and fell in love with Skyline, and the Cincinnati chili on the coney was on point. Our waitress said the previous owners were from Cincinnati and brought the recipe with them. Well they nailed it. I also did a brat that was good, but after the coney nothing was going to come close. We did the pimento cheese fries for an appetizer, and I loved the homemade pimento cheese. It's got a slightly different taste than normal pimento, but especially on the fries it just worked perfectly. My only complaint was the lack of air conditioning on a hot day, but once we settled in and had a few drinks it wasn't an issue.

L9fSb_ZgBJfnr71FYvFzYw.text: One of my favorite burgers in Charlotte. Consistently delicious, fresh and fast. Just stick to the basics, you won't be disappointed.   Each burger comes with two patties. Meat is cooked fresh upon ordering and is the right ratio for the size of the bun and other toppings.   The staff has even delivered my order to the neighboring bars in Latta Arcade (when they are not too busy) so I didn't have to wait.   Good selection of beers too!

kjacWvPLUa7Qj_x8ME90qw.text: Great fast service even on a busy holiday July 4th. Thanks Rachel! Cincinnati 5way chili was on point, craft beer and liquor, we will definitely be back!

CSYXoq7fCkHpIr-nwqyEpw.text: Queen City Beer and Chili does not disappoint!!  I had been waiting for this spot to open up for a while since I see it every time I'm in Brevard court grabbing lunch- glad to see it finally opened.  Went here for lunch so I could not partake in the beer, but I will definitely be back- either to grab a couple pints or fill a growler up to take home.  Love the concept.  The two chili dogs I had for lunch were spot on.  I went with the meal combo 3 which consists of two dogs, a side, and a drink.   They do not have many menu offerings but they make a strong showcase of their chili using various food vessels. My buddy got the nachos that were made of their house chips and a ton of toppings (added bacon for a dollar fidy).  Super reasonable prices for the food - seems like the more Charlotte grows the more expensive lunch uptown becomes.  The right side of the place is where you order the food, you can either take it out or bring it into the bar area where they have about 6 tables- or sit at the bar!  Modern warm wood covers the entire space and there is exposed brick on the bar side (left side).  Edison bulbs win the growler shades adorn the ceilings and give the bar a pretty great relaxed atmosphere.  Staff was super nice and made sure we were happy with how everything turned out.  I definitely will be back to partake in the 20 beers they have on tap.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar with 20 taps!
Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. Growlers!
Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fries

CMDi32ps3h_PUrXKwF4dyQ.text: I was looking forward to trying this place out after seeing it come together over the last several months.   Two dogs, side & drink for $10. I think that's a pretty darn good deal, especially being in Uptown. For my two dogs I opted for the Cincinnati style & the New York style. If you're into carolina style with the slaw on it, it looked realllly good, I just don't care for slaw. My favorite was the cincinnati style (probably a little biased since I'm from Ohio). The cooked onions & mustard on it were awesome. The chili on both was exceptional, and couldn't can't go wrong. The fried jalapeno caps were a great side choice (watch out for the red ones mixed in ... they're HOT).   My only 'complaint' was that they got a little soggy. My recommendation for management would be to either toast the buns a wee bit, or not put the mustard on the bottom of the New York dog? Other than that, it was a great choice. The inside is small, but they've done it up very nice. I'll definitley be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cincinnati Coney (bottom) New York Weiner (top) Jalapeño caps

eIc0QTR4f1Nb8TVW6s1QqA.text: QCBC is a cool little spot that's off the beaten path. It is very small but does offer a verity of craft beers and does have tasty food options. However, I was unable to try the my appetizer of choosing and they only had French fry options. I will say this tho! Those French frys were awesome though!! The beer was ice cold and the service was fast and friendly. If you are in the area stop in!

s-MEYlOmjDE5psBAS93dLg.text: Great craft beer selection. Went on a warmer afternoon so it was hot in the restaurant, but the service was great. Food was good. Not a large menu but still had a good time with some great brews

E76ubvzkQFCmZJSWindwpw.text: The Carolina dog is good but the white chicken chili is great! You know a good chili from a bad one when A) you can eat with a fork and B) when The fork stands up in the bowl. Well done!

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States

8ZqQKcE7oPNPXEVTBcsjMw.text: Great beers, great food, great people. Try the peanut butter and jelly beer, and grab some fried apps and a burger!

XESZjvMevQycgFBw-u5g8g.text: My co-worker and I planned to pick something up and take it back to the office since we only had about 45 minutes for lunch. We told the greeter our predicament and he said that he was pretty sure he could get us in and out in that timeframe.  He wasn't kidding!  My QCBC (American) burger and my co-worker's Blackbean burger were ready within 10 minutes.  I'm a sucker for a nicely grilled bun so they pretty much had me right there. The meat was juicy and flavorful and the toppings were fresh and chilled.  It really hit the spot.  The fries were crunchy on the outside, but fluffy on the inside, which was perfect.  If I could suggest one thing, I'd say to give us a few more fries. But overall, it was excellent.  The staff was friendly and efficient. The building was a little cozy, but it had a nice atmosphere. Plus, there is additional seating outside.  Needless to say, we'll be back -- soon.

nzMAqSsQBrWbEBrm3RTIuA.text: Terrific beer selection. Reasonable prices. Staff is very friendly and attentive. Really enjoyed the QCBC burger and fries. Cupcakes were also delicious.

gFvvc3jjhcmSn3bgpdEcuQ.text: Delicious burgers, onion rings, fried pickles and poutine fries. Service was great too! Definite must eat near French Quarter!

S7Tm7KQ7obeRWwg7IdvJnA.text: This is a great laid-back chill spot if you're looking to grab some drinks and some hearty food (chili, burgers, hot dogs).   It's a pretty small venue, but it's clean and they don't blast music so it's easy to converse with your company. Don't expect a fine-dining sit-down setting. You place your order and they serve it to you in paper/foam plates like a food truck.  Nice selection of beers, but here's the pro tip: Each day they have a "Kick the Keg" beer special, where they put 2 beers on sale and you can get a pitcher for like $7 or $8. Basically for the price of a beer anywhere else, you can get an entire pitcher. It may not be your favorite beer, but it's still solid and the volume pays for itself.  Have only tried the chili cheese fries and those were good. Service is friendly and fast, and the prices are fair. I would go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chili Cheese Fries.

Aw1rdTWEy4a_C_GxNNWsfQ.text: Previously a unique spot for good priced pitchers of craft beer. Now another overpriced nothing special spot in Charlotte, wont go back. Won't even sell pitchers anymore, much better options in uptown, don't wast your time here.

uic7s0jj_js_P1nl7wwJxA.text: This place is the shiznit! Excellent beer menu and some seriously good chili. They've got all the bases covered for real chili lovers. They've got your classic Texas style chili but with a hint of beans, perfectly seasoned. Don't worry Texans, the bean to beef ratio is more than reasonable...it's mostly beef, you won't feel cheated. For Midwesterners they've got the perfect chili for smothering all over a good old fashioned middle America style chili dog. ?Folks from the Southwest won't feel left out when they see the green chili on the menu. Granted, it's chicken instead of pork, but still pretty cool to see that green chili all the way out in Charlotte! For me, the most exciting thing about QCBC is the good old fashioned chillighetti (spaghetti noodles topped with chili, cheese, and onions) that I grew up eating in Illinois, ahhh, Heaven.   QCBC, we'll be back!

_1oaCAvgqg_kTBe9Fiun0w.text: First time visiting and it won't be the last! Service was on point and food was delicious. We had chili...3 choice platter which included smoked sausage, ribs and pulled pork. The mac & cheese is like grandma's.  Baked beans and collard greens seasoned like homemade. Great choice for lunch or dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked chicken with over 5 sauces to choose from!
Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ribs, pulled pork and smoked sausage. Sides baked beans &amp; mac &amp; cheese.
Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great choices...chili came with nachos.

dOc3L4JQzx20BzXZb9Slpg.text: I never knew how much I loved pimento cheese before trying the pimento fries and the pim-baco-chee burger at qcbc. Staff is always amazing and there is a rotating plethora of amazing beer on tap! One of the best places I've ever been!!!

_XEU-5zMwrhqAhP3YMmovg.text: Great stop for a selection of 20 beers for the discerning beer drinker. Bring a growler or grab one of Queen City's and have a pint, fill a growler, repeat.   Great spot. Worth the trip.  Finally a filling station in Charlotte that has a great selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States

T_lpeBXXwoHiic-d4g9jzw.text: My review is based solely on the Pimento Fries, which we ordered at a nearby bar whose food comes from QCBC -- yum!!

JMixE1-H6K85Y_I88tLAIA.text: My BF and I stopped into this quaint little bar after visiting the NASCAR Hall of Fame last Saturday. They have a good selection of craft beers and a great menu. The bartender was really cool and he let us sample a few of the dark beers. Our favorite was definitely the Mexican chocolate stout (can't remember the exact name). We ordered the Bavarian pretzel with beer cheese to start, and my boyfriend ordered a burger and I ordered the buffalo chicken burger for lunch. Everything was delicious and cooked perfectly. If you're in the Charlotte area, you must stop here for some delicious food and a few beers!

ecQeXQOodRrbNyxObVxhfw.text: Ran across this little gem last night while out in Uptown. I ordered a cider and a Carolina classic hotdog basket. My husband got a burger that had pimento cheese (YUMMY) and a beer called Juicy J's. That was one of the best hotdogs I've ever had.  The chili was amazing!! I would definitely visit again

flMqt_-CqC1L00F2wz7Dtw.text: Big flavors and burgers coming from a cozy burger and craft beer joint in the French Quarter.  The beer selection is top notch with tons of options. Beer came to my table cold and quick!  I ordered the Poutine. Classic fries with a rich dark gravy and real cheddar curds. The curds were just melting and super creamy.  Next came my Pim-Baco-Chee burger. 2 patties, nice soft bun and full of flavor.  On my next visit, I'll opt for the soft pretzel over the poutine. It was French fry overload with the poutine. Although, I could have asked for a different side.  Service was exceptional. Super friendly staff. Very attentive! If I lived in CLT, this would be a great hangout.

UiQLLbZ4TI_SKwNcpBSRZg.text: Dude behind the bar was great.   Out of towner that was in looking for guidance on local scene.   Did a great job of setting me up and talking through local options.    Also just a great job in having a conversation with someone sitting at bar.    Pretty much what I'm looking for in a new town

SCjTB0CH3HuR5Y6UqzteGg.text: Post marathon pre-selected choice for beer by my friends and no complaints from me. I love seasonal beers and had two that were recommended by the bartender. She was very personable and took the time to explain the beer she had on tap.  This place doesn't have a lot of space inside but had plenty of room to accommodate our crew of 8. A few pub tables, larger tables in the middle, and a decent-sized bar. We didn't stay very long and I decided not to order any food as we already had plans. I heard they have great chili and looking back, it was a mistake not to do that as cold as it was.  I think this would be a cool spot to come back to. My instinct is that it would fill up relatively quickly, so perhaps a trip outside of peak hours would be the best call. It was minutes away from the marathon finish and turned out to be a no brainer to come here.

pK1Jwjcc7kLTO6WBgPo6nQ.text: Popped in for a pitcher of craft beer with my coworker. Got a pitcher of a local Octoberfest for $13! That is a steal no matter where you live. The beer was fresh and cold and delicious. Enjoyed the beverages outside on the seating area in the alley way and had a great afternoon before the Thursday night football game.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. Alleyway

vHBuYA91oUZZgeFSjbgq-w.text: Great spot!!! Went in for the chili but the chickens wings were the star!  The lemon pepper dry rubbed chicken wings are the best wings I've EVER had, they're  addicting!!! Chili was good, but the wings, devine.

5qLE2jssQNHRKJy4RP4kyw.text: So finding a good quality restaurant open on a Sunday was found to be a little challenging but QCBC was open.  It's more of a bar/ but I saw the high reviews and blogs. The waitress was very kind. Prices seemed at first glance on par,  but not a bargain. i ordered a chili cheese fry as an appetizer. For $8.50 it seemed a little pricey for this item for how it was bought out.  For my meal, ordered the philysteak with a side salad $13. The Philly was served on a smaller sized toasted hot dog bun. The beef had very little flavor and was chewy. $1.50 for a soda with refills was the best deal here! Overall this place serves decent pub food which is always a bonus to have while your our drinking or just having a beer.  It's definitely not fine dining or the kind of pricing that would make you want to return just for the food.  I am being kind with a 4 out of 5 because nothing stood out here. For $25 it seemed pricey and basic.  If you do eat here get the $4 hot dogs -  $3 fries - Chilli and BEER because that's what this place is about. I can say they are kind and polite. This is a a perfect place for a snack (light eat) and a beer with a friend, but if your looking for a nice dinner experience with quality food, keep on looking!

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States

2IJulpHobH83bb7_JrBIkQ.text: Great little place.  Nice bar with lots of taps.  I had the QCBC burger with their "own" rub on the burger.  Whatever their rub was, it was AWESOME!  Wait staff was cool and helpful.

4xKspY3nXxknoodQna-XWA.text: Nice staff and place but the burgers were extremely dry... Maybe this was a one off situation? No matter, it was so bad that I won't be giving them another try. They do sell TRULY though!

YBflOmK9tHLAVOaE9SKW7g.text: Bartender was very sweet and helped me pick the perfect beer for a hot day. She offered a small sample beforehand so I wasn't disappointed. If I lived in NC I'd definitely be coming back for Thirsty Thursday $4 All Draft And Can Beer. Very happy with my experience.

qAGQbpKBBY1pcP5cAy5KBQ.text: My kids and I were uptown (Pokemon hunting) and stumbled through Latta Arcade looking for a bite to eat. Any parent with a picky eater knows this can be a difficult task, finding one of the 3 things your kid will eat while also having a wide selection for yourself.   My oldest is always down for a burger (plain, literally meat and bread only) QCBC's menu was posted in the window of its storefront and we hit gold! Burgers for $6, pretzels (for the picky eater) and a Carolina style sloppy burger for mom...SCORE!  The bartender wasn't too attentive and seemed a little more interested in his beer drinking (and tipping customers) but I got his attention and placed an order. To my surprise dude stepped up and packed our stuff up for a great picnic lunch. He even asked how I wanted the fries packed and suggested separate so they don't get wet from the chili (however I would not mind but kids...).  We took our massive Togo order all packed with every utensil, condiment and plenty of napkins across the street to Romare Bearden Park and spread out in the sun at which time we laid out and devoured those burgers. The ratio of chili, slaw, onions, cheese and mustard to burger was perfect. Even the bun was amazing, grilled with a buttery crust which kept it from getting soggy. The pretzels were huge and fresh which is how I would explain the fries too.   This is my new burger joint and I intend to bring my family back. Until then I will stroll down to QCBC on my lunch breaks for some chili on the first cool fall day in uptown.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States

751X8CoN4JuybswFsvxJYQ.text: Burger is so tasty! Brews are cold and tap options are seemingly endless.  Staff is  friendly at this tucked away small spot downtown on the arcade alley.  The burger is not greasy, topped with cheese and fresh tomato, lettuce, onion and so so so good.   Fried pickles good with a tiny kick.  Fries are good, 1.00 up charge from the chip side.

ChMoPY5gkWviGWujA5vRqA.text: A Yelp find! Ol trusty Yelp machine at it again... A friend and I had just finished up at the Charlotte International Auto Show and decided to stick around Up/Downtown. The location wasn't what I originally pictured, but it was definitely a quaint little spot in the heart of the French Quarter. Apparently, it has recently changed to QCBC from a different format.  The bartender was very friendly offering suggestions when it came to food on the menu, the drinks on tap and other drinks she could make for you.  There are just shy of 20 rotating craft brews on tap, plus a selection of liquors if you dare. They have a special where you can get one beer and a select whiskey for $10.   We both ordered burgers. He went with the bartenders fave - the pimento cheese bacon burger , and I opted for the basic burger. All served with your choice of side item. They came out fairly quick and on no frills paper plates. The burger and fresh fries were very delicious! He was still hungry so he went back for seconds and ordered a loaded Carolina dog and devoured it -- says it was tasty. Against my better judgement I wanted something else as well so I put in an order of beer cheese fries. Man it came out steaming hot! It was tasty as well, but the beer cheese is very thin and 'soupy' .. booo! I wonder if there is a way to thicken it up a bit? It'd be even better!  Apparently, they are known for serving delicious chili. We'll have to make it back and give that a try! I'd go back for sure.

i7LNaiIuKhNH4l0w3WbQaA.text: I'm torn about this spot... The food is average. The beer selection is good. The location is great.   First, the food... Your run of the mill bar grub -- burgers, hotdogs, fries. You would think the chili would steal the show but it's really pretty bland and lacks that pizazz or spice I enjoy in a good chili.   Next, the beer selection... Lots of great, local choices on draft. 20 choices, to be exact. I like that they offer flights because I am indecisive and like to sample lots!   Lastly, the location... I love Brevard Court. It reminds me of a little alley in Europe. It's really an oasis right in the heart of uptown Charlotte. The interior of QCBC is nice, too. Lots of sleek wood. High top tables and a few seats at the bar. It's teeny-tiny though, so if anything is happening uptown (especially a Knights Game) expect a packed house.   So, moral of this story is, I wish they'd up their food game. I would be inclined to visit more if there was something I really loved and craved on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. All the beer.
Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chili cheese fries all the waaaaaaay.

0pbTYFTsI4NKFpUBPZOKzA.text: Tried QC for a burger and beer last evening.  Great service,  great food.  The burgers were messy and flavorful.  Had a chicken skin nacho... never even heard of that before,  but want it again! Owner was on site and interested in good experience for customers. Service was just right! We will be back!

NtgRaS8nYKy3KEFUC2196A.text: I was visiting my girlfriend from out of town and we we're walking around Charlotte looking for a spot to have brunch, outside QCBC had a special for tomato soup and grilled cheese! PERFECT! We walked in, was greeted by Donte ((hope I remembered his name correctly)) and he took our order. He was very personable and we engaged in conversation with him. The food came out fast and hot. The tomato soup was perfect it wasn't super creamy and it had very little chunks so you know it was homemade. The grilled cheese was phenomenal. We also ordered some fried pickles which were amazing as well. The owner Everett, came out to see how we were doing and how we liked everything. I went to school for culinary so some say I'm super picky. However I will definitely be going back and trying other menu items. They both made us feel at home. The place was super clean I honestly have nothing bad to say at all except that it 6 hours away from me ahahaha. Highly recommend this place if you're looking for a Cozy home feeling.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Pickles
Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tomato Soup and Grilled Cheese

Jf5XsRk_vK3R0AHOvv-mzg.text: Tried this place yesterday, and the food was really good. My husband ordered the cheesesteak , it was delicious but a little small for 11.50  I had the pamanto and bacon burger and it was also delicious. We had onion rings and fries both were great. This place is in a great location uptown outside lata arcade, near the park ect. Just a fun place inside and out.

pLvOkuX7kasL34iYhDQQZw.text: Nice, small, and friendly atmosphere tucked away in a side street area. It has a sports bar atmosphere but much smaller than your traditional sports bar, which isn't a bad thing!  They have a good selection of beers and some really good burgers.

P27zV-ux7k3V_mIvxmyujw.text: Had a great experience! Was in the city to check out the Girl Tribe Pop Up and the weather was gorgeous so we ended up walking around the city. Once we realized we were hungry we made our way to QCBC.   We sat outside - again, gorgeous day - and the staff was super attentive even being out there. Our water was refilled in a timely manner and we were regularly checked on to see if we needed anything else.  Bf ordered the veggie burger with chips and I had nachos with white chicken chili on them. I know my bf liked his burger, but I loved my nachos. They were very flavorful and filling. Would definitely go back!

_56vVxacp5ADiHaWCE9TAw.text: Financial hipsters unite!  This place is an amazingly good spot to pick up lunch or some beers after work. It's tiny and you might walk right by it, but if you do stumble in, sit down and enjoy the beers on tap and try the food.   I recently had the Kickstarter burger (see photo) and a couple beers for lunch. The food was super good and I really didn't feel like going back to work after the beers. They carry a great selection, mostly NC breweries, and they also have bottles and cans of your favorites.   The staff is great and attentive. They are running all around at lunch time to make sure everyone is happy. I highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Kickstarter

p5qLsnHiyiRlSll5qItqQA.text: Beer! Burgers! Chili! Liquor! Wine! Wings! Nachos! Sweets! Salads! Sports! Awesome bartenders! Fast kitchen staff! Open for lunch everyday! Prosecco on tap!

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. Craft beer cans and wine!
Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. Patio tables!

qdCPZzpGE2Db98h6O-JIrQ.text: I've been on a low carb diet... so why did I even choose this place?!? Well let me tell you! It was so good. I had the fatty unwich... lol I know such a contradiction. But that chipotle mayo was 100z so goood. The fried pickles were over cooked and that was so disappointing. However the chili cheese fries all the way were very good but could have used some salt. The pieces were bad though. I spent about 10 on my meal.   It's really cool inside too but it is kind of small. There was outside seating too.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States

iW-jYnaLSZVzcS_XG9vBKQ.text: The wings blew me away; Delicious Dry rub and extra crispy! What didn't blow me away? Was the service... Waitress was inattentive and approached our table each time as if it were a chore. The outdoor seating is my favorite, it feels like you're in a quaint European alley.

6pyf5EeIGCIZFFffP89PfA.text: This little place is a gem of a find right in uptown Charlotte! Me and my hubs just happened upon this place after sitting at a neighboring establishment and having no one come to the table to greet us!  We walked in to be greeted immediately and within less than 2 minutes our drink orders were taken!! Friendly staff, super cool environment, somewhat like you would find in Asheville!! Food was amazing. Service was impeccable. Wings are a must try with the Jamaican Jerk dry rub along with the Poutine! (Fries with gravy and cheese curds) We will be going back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fries with brown gravy and cheese curds and hotdog with chili and slaw!!!!!

PD3tz15tnREaTLTG0MVStw.text: Walked in during lunch because it was freezing and I was craving some chili. I remember that this place was originally named Queen City Beer and Chili or so I thought.   I wanted to order a hotdog and a cup of chili but they don't serve cups of their chili. You have to order a full size which is pricey at $10 for the traditional. The chili came out and it was smaller than I excepted for $10 and it was barely warm.   This place seems to have steered away from the focus of chili, they offer a lot more sandwiches. While in the restaurant I noticed that several ppl didn't understand the system of ordering. They run table service but it seems like they have more take out orders. I would suggest that they block off the corner of the bar for people to walk up too like a register/Togo station.   Overpriced and very average would be my summary. I walked away after spending over $17 with tip and got only one dog and chili that was warm. JJs Red hot is within walking distance and I could have gotten a better dog for less!

1ZkNoHUYTcx4wvI8Au0jwQ.text: I work nearby and have passed by several times and today I decided to give them a try. Im glad I did!  The place isn't that big, but it wasn't crowded to the point where I couldn't find seating. I was greeted right away by very friendly staff. I sat at the bar. I wasn't exactly sure what I wanted and it was recommended that I tried one of the burgers.   I placed an order for the Kickstarter Burger. It came with a fried egg, bacon, cheese, chipotle mayo and Tabasco. It was very good. It wasn't too spicy if you don't like spicy food. The food came really quick. The burger came with fries and they were actually salted perfectly.   Normally for lunch, I feel like I'm waiting for my food forever. All in all, I was seated, placed my order, ate and paid, all in a matter of 30 minutes. Which is great, as it means I will for sure come back during my hectic lunch hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States

AelWikq5KG7AhydN4OOuRw.text: The burgers are outstanding. And the beer selection is wonderful and delicious. You can try a taste before ordering a pint. Everett is a doll. Kind and interested. Has lots of good ideas of what to do around town. We met the chef and thanked him for the tasty food and the sides. Fries are awesome. Chips - gone. Everett and a local at the bar gave us tips on what to do in Charlotte and what to do in the area as well. Such a tasty lunch. We loved the food, drinks and overall energy of the joint. Come here. You won't be disappointed!

ABC0bAeXDFmS7KvDoZKXXA.text: Nice little spot!! The bartender (wish I could remember his name) was spot on with everyone there.  Really big PLUS, ALL the nfl games were on. There's food there too but we didn't not eat. Sure it's good tho.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States

VNNxeNNTNWTH55IqJVm6TQ.text: Great service. Food came out fast. Chili cheese fries are a must. Prices are really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cobb salad!!

nP4QiUetquT_G7xn1-_1wg.text: The only reason I am giving them 2 stars is because the hot dog is good. However, the waitress, Rachel, was rude & the food is overpriced. I will not be returning. There are better hot dog spots in Charlotte & definitely friendlier servers. I ordered a cheese coney with a side of fries. I was surprised to receive a handful of fries which did not seem worth the $3. I asked Rachel about it and she replied, "that's our portion size."   I see why this place is always empty. I won't be returning & suggest you stay away too!

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. $3 side of fries?

t_E6eUMxNgh1ojYeaLQlFQ.text: What a great hole-in-the-wall burger and beer joint. Guy working behind the bar couldn't have been nicer. Music was laid back, awesome beer list and the Mushroom Swiss burger was great. A+!!

-0tbLP7aWltU-WMf93NMLg.text: Great place! Diverse menu, food & full liquor bar~ and the craft beer selection? Boom. Awesome. Staff is extremely friendly~ prices rock.  Love this place~ come find it!

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States

dM2xCcm30D6Xy6_fEqX1cw.text: Once you try this almost-hidden spot at the Brevard Court, you'll kick yourself for all that time you wasted having drafts instead of crafts.  Here's why: - More than 15 taps pouring crafts. - Constantly rotating crafts selection. Duh! - Friendly bartenders. Shout out to Rochelle.   Tip: Great beer. Average food Four and Half Yelps

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheeseburger

_LUFHaKOmVFBOunldQN51w.text: This place is a gem! Great beer selections, really good black bean burger. Tried the side of fried pickles, yum! Super friendly staff.

JRxpKcDEaqNoayBO6HM8Sw.text: I stumbled upon this little gem on my way for lunch, and wow it was amazing. This restaurant is small but has a lot of character and what it lacks in size it makes up in the food. I decided to order the chipotle jalapeno burger with a side of fried pickles. The burger was juicy and had great flavor, however I felt that it lacked a sauce that would just take it over the edge. The service was quick and staff was knowledgeable. I would definitely be back soon for lunch or even for a beer.

2nxnG3eyTac6-y11KFBsXA.text: This my first time here. Everett the co-owner was kind enough to welcome us into the newly  owned QCBC. The Chicken Chili is amazing . Christopher was our Bartender and waiter he was amazing great suggestions and recommendations. The #1 Spice Merchant Chai Cider add a fireball shot $10 . I also had the #16 Fools Gold Imperial Mocha Blonde Stout (11.9% ABV- you only need 2) the service was so amazingams welcoming. I will definitely be back?

photos.caption: Photo of Queen City Bites & Crafts - Charlotte, NC, United States. White chicken chili fries and #16

s_-cPdytvAft23WuIXdfjg.text: Awesome spot. Small, but quiet with plenty of TVs for whatever game you're interested in.  I got the Carolina Chili Dog, which was awesome. There were plenty of beers on tap with a big selection of canned beers as well.  Wait staff was attentive and fast. I definitely recommend if you're in the area and looking for a neat little spot to hang out.

uXQ3C4P07YJ8p9pZlFuT8w.text: stopped in here for a late lunch on a sunday with my boyfriend. i got the poutine and he got the kickstarter burger and we both loved our meals! would definitely recommend to anyone in the charlotte area looking for a casual lunch/dinner
